citations.narrative:
A wallaby escaped its enclosure due to handling errors. The licensee was off property when the neighbor called at
approximately 4:00pm on June 15, 2025 stating they had seen the wallaby in the area. The licensee went home to
discover the gate had been left unlocked and was ajar. To date, wallaby has been sighted in the area but all attempts to
capture it have been unsuccessful.
During the same period as the gate was opened and the wallaby escaped, the licensee went to check the other animal
enclosures, he found two cavy’s dead. One cavy had an odd tilt to the neck and there was blood on the hindquarters and
nose. The second cavy was dead with blood above the right front shoulder. According to the licensee, it’s possible that an
animal was able to access their enclosure through the open gate.
In not adequately securing the enclosure, containment and safety of the animals were compromised leading to escape of
the wallaby and harm and subsequent death to the two cavy’s. Handling occurred with animal related activities requiring
that personnel properly enter and exit enclosures while ensuring the health and safety of the animals. The handling of
animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma or physical harm.
Correct by: June 20, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
A wallaby escaped its enclosure due to handling errors. The licensee was off property when the neighbor called at 
approximately 4:00pm on June 15, 2025 stating they had seen the wallaby in the area. The licensee went home to 
discover the gate had been left unlocked and was ajar. To date, wallaby has been sighted in the area but all attempts to 
capture it have been unsuccessful.  
 
During the same period as the gate was opened and the wallaby escaped, the licensee went to check the other animal 
enclosures, he found two cavy’s dead. One cavy had an odd tilt to the neck and there was blood on the hindquarters and 
nose. The second cavy was dead with blood above the right front shoulder. According to the licensee, it’s possible that an 
animal was able to access their enclosure through the open gate. 
 
In not adequately securing the enclosure, containment and safety of the animals were compromised leading to escape of 
the wallaby and harm and subsequent death to the two cavy’s. Handling occurred with animal related activities requiring 
that personnel properly enter and exit enclosures while ensuring the health and safety of the animals. The handling of 
animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma or physical harm. 
 
Correct by: June 20, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
